full_text:
Typelists

Lesson
objectives

Describe the functionality of a Typelist
Create a Typelist and a Typelist extension
Create a Typekey field

Create a Typekey field that references a
Typelist filter

Gi

User Story: Invoicing Method Gi

“After further analysis, we decided that the invoicing method of each policy also has
to be stored in TrainingApp. The invoicing method specifies how the premium will be
collected for the policy. An insurance company allows only the following 3 invoicing
methods:

« 10% down payment and 11 installments
« 30% down payment and 4 installments
« 50% down payment and 2 installments

We are still working on the UI requirements, so please configure the Data Model
only for now.”

- Insurance Company Business Analysts

Gi

i Typelist G
Details
¢ ATypelist is a fixed, predefined list of

values (Typecodes)

Person Info | Phone &Addresses | Bank Accounts

¢ Values cannot be dynamically added or
removed during runtime

i Typelists and Typekey fields

¢ ATypekey field is an entity field associated with a specific Typelist
¢ Referenced Typelist contains the list of possible values for the Typekey field

* The Typekey field can point to one of these Typecodes

BankAccount

BankName
RoutingNumber

AccountNumber

Typekey field

Typelist

BankAccountType

Checking
Savings
Other

Typecodes

logic part of custom * Customers can modify the

or extended extension

i Typelists in the data model G

principles as entities

* Defined as XML files
* TTI, TIX and TTX files

« ...\Metadata\Typelist
folder read-only and
contains platform and

Typelists

« ...\Extensions\Typelist
folder contains
everything customer
specific

i Typelists in the data model (continued) Ga

i) * Kinds of Typelists:

* ValidationLevel is
extendable

¢ ActivityStatus is internal
* BuildingCode_Ext is
custom
¢ Virtual typelists don’t
physically exist in the
data model

ValidationLevel InvoiceStatus

ValidationLevel ActivityStatus

i Typelists and Typekey fields in the database

Typelists are stored as database tables

Typecodes are stored as rows in the table

Typekeys are stored as foreign key

columns in the entity table

ID TYPECODE |NAME RETIRED

10001 | checking Checking|FALSE

40002/savings Savings |FALSE
other Other FALSE

ACCOUNTNUMBER

BANKNAME ROUTINGNUMBER

ACME Credit Union| 123-987 345678900

National Bank 745-222 232323566 10001
ACME Credit Union| 123-999 112233445 10001
ACME Credit Union| 225-999 §54433221 10002

i Typefilters G
¢ ATypelist filter causes the Typelist to display only a subset of the Typecodes for
that Typelist
¢ Multiple Typefilters can be defined in a Typelist

¢ ATypekey field can reference at most one Typefilter from the associated Typelist

i Demonstration G
Invoicing Method

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

_- — What are some of the differences between the files in the

..\Metadata\Typelist\ and...\Extensions\Typelist\ folders?
4

Se Sess e ese ssc esaeK

Answer

_- — What are some of the differences between the files in the

¢
¢

SS Se SSeS sess e eases

: ..\Metadata\Typelist\ and...\Extensions\Typelist\ folders?

Files under Metadata are read-only and are specific to the base configuration.

You cannot create Typelist files in the Metadata directory but can create Typelist
files in the Extensions directory.

Only internal Typelist extension files (TIX) are in the Metadata directory.
Only external Typelist files (TTX) are in the Extensions directory.
Both directories contain Typelist (TT1) files.

Question G

_- — Which is a valid code value for a Typecode in a food coloring Typelist?

4
o A) RedDye#1

B) YellowDye40
C) OrangeDye:10

Se Sess e ese ssc esaeK

Answer

7
¢
¢

SS Se SSeS sess e eases

_- — Which is a valid code value for a Typecode in a food coloring Typelist?

A) RedDye#1
B) YellowDye40
C) OrangeDye:10

A) Not valid
B) Valid
C) Not valid

Gi

Question

,- — Which Typecode attribute determines the order in which Typecodes are
Pa listed in the user interface?

Se Sess e ese ssc esaeK

Gi

Answer

,- — Which Typecode attribute determines the order in which Typecodes are
Pa listed in the user interface?
“ The priority attribute determines the sort order in the User Interface for a Typelist. After

priority, the name (not code) determines the sort order. Entries with priority -1 appear
at the end of the list.

SS Se SSeS sess e eases

Gi

Question

,— — What does a Typefilter do?

¢
¢
4

Se Sess e ese ssc esaeK

Answer

a What does a Typefilter do?

¢
¢

Defines a named subset of the Typecodes that could be used as value for the
associated Typekey field that references this Typelist.

SS Se SSeS sess e eases
